title: Predict: k-NN Decision Boundaries
story: Smaller k = more complex boundaries (risk overfitting). Larger k = smoother boundaries (risk underfitting). Balance is key!
instructions: Predict which k value creates more complex decision boundaries. k=1 or k=5? Print the k value that creates MORE COMPLEX boundaries.
starterCode:
# k=1: Each point creates its own region (very complex)
# k=5: Smoother regions by averaging 5 neighbors (simpler)

# k=1 is more complex
print(1)

tests.description: Should print 1 (k=1 creates most complex boundaries)
tests.expectedBehavior: Understand k affects decision boundary complexity

hints.text: k=1 uses only nearest neighbor (very sensitive to noise, complex boundaries).
Smaller k = more complex = overfitting risk. Larger k = smoother = underfitting risk.
